articles.title: U.S. Citizen Released
articles.content:
U.S. Citizen Released
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- U.S. citizen Otto Frederick Warmbier, who had been in hard labor, was sent back home on June 13, 2017 on humanitarian grounds according to the adjudication made on the same day by the Central Court of the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Head's Speech at Int'l Meeting Concerning Rights of Disabled
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Head's Speech at Int'l Meeting Concerning Rights of Disabled
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Ri Hung Sik of the DPRK Foreign Ministry who is heading the DPRK delegation on June 13 made a speech at the 10th session of the Conference of States Parties to the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities now under way in New York.
					 Referring to the policy and efforts of the DPRK government for promoting the human rights and protecting rights of the disabled, the ambassador said:
					
					 The DPRK is a socialist state centered on the popular masses where human being is placed at the center of everything and everything of the society serves people. It is the supreme principle of the state activities to give priority to the people's interests and convenience and the struggle to this end is mandatory by the constitution.
					
					 Today in the DPRK all members of society including persons with disabilities are truly enjoying genuine human rights thanks to respected Supreme Leader Comrade Kim Jong Un's policy of valuing the people.
					
					 The DPRK attaches importance to the implementation of the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and to the international cooperation in protecting and promoting the rights of persons with disabilities. 
					
					 It was from this perspective that the DPRK signed the Convention in July 2013, made amendments to and supplemented its Law on Protection of Persons with Disabilities in line with the Convention and ratified the Convention last November.
					
					 Although it is exposed to constant political and military threats from outside, the DPRK is waging an all-people drive to implement 2016-2020 five-year strategy for national economic development.
					
					 In implementation of the Convention, the DPRK attaches importance to international cooperation including the technical and humanitarian assistance by the UN agencies.
					
					 In this regard, I would like to make special reference to the successful visit of the Special Rapporteur of the UNHRC on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities to the DPRK in early May this year, which was made as a part of the implementation of the Convention. 
					
					 I am convinced that the visit by the Special Rapporteur served as a significant occasion in promoting mutual understanding and establishing and developing constructive relations of cooperation between the DPRK and the Committee on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. 
					
					 Clarifying once again the principled stand of the DPRK on the issue of human rights, the ambassador went on:
					
					 The DPRK totally rejects politicization, selectivity and double standard in the international human rights arena and resolutely opposes any attempts to use human rights for ill-intended political purposes. However, it remains consistent in its stand of attaching importance to dialogue and negotiation for protection and promotion of genuine human rights including the rights of persons with disabilities in the international human rights arena. 
					
					 In other words, the DPRK is against all kinds of extremely politicized human rights debate, which has nothing to do with human rights, being pursued by the hostile forces with wicked intention of overthrowing governments of sovereign states, based on lies and fabrications from fugitive criminals who fled their home country to desert the nation and even families, but actively supports dialogue and cooperation for protection and promotion of genuine human rights. 
					
					 The DPRK, as a state party to the Convention, will honor its responsibility in accomplishing the 10-year goals for implementing the Convention set forth by this Conference and make substantial contributions to the international efforts to implement the Convention through increased exchange and cooperation with the Committee on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and other international organizations and countries.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Media Slammed for Hurting Dignity of DPRK Supreme Leadership
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Media Slammed for Hurting Dignity of DPRK Supreme Leadership
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Central Committee of the Journalists Union of Korea issued a statement Thursday to denounce the south Korean puppet conservative media for daring fault the Workers' Party of Korea's policy of loving the rising generations and the future.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The conservative media of south Korea including KBS, MBN and Yonhap News branded the 8th Congress of the Korean Children's Union as a "demonstration event for maintaining social system" and even hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 The public broadcasting service KBS put forward experts and "defectors from the north" to talk about "the children on the market" and "limitations of instilling ideology", giving impression that there are some changes in the idea of the youths and children of the DPRK.
					
					 This clearly shows that confrontation hysteria of the conservative group and hack writers of south Korea, seeking to make even children scapegoats for its plot-breeding against the DPRK, has gone beyond the red line.
					
					 We have already clearly warned that the puppet conservative media and journalists will be made to pay a dear price for their distortion of reality and propaganda against the DPRK, the statement said, clarifying:
					
					 Firm and steadfast is our stand to inflict merciless punishment on those who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK wherever they might be on the earth.
					
					 The puppet conservative media and the reptile writers who slandered the WPK's noble politics of loving the rising generations and the future, and those who organized and instigated such smear campaign will be made to suffer constant horror and uneasiness from this moment.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities are truly interested in improving the north-south relations, they should make an immediate investigation into the conservative media's hideous provocation against the DPRK and punish those responsible.
					
					 If this demand is turned down, we will regard the recent case as an act masterminded by the south Korean authorities and will force them to pay dearly for it.
					
					 Those who challenged the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership can never go scot-free.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Should Not Mock Nation and Public: CCNR Spokesman
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Should Not Mock Nation and Public: CCNR Spokesman
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- A spokesman of the Consultative Council for National Reconciliation (CCNR) issued a statement Thursday as the joint national event of Koreans in the north and the south and abroad was not held due to the south Korean authorities' wavering and equivocal stand though it was planned to be held on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 The approach to the joint national event was a touchstone distinguishing the present ruling authorities' stand to the improvement of the north-south relations and national reunification, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 But they took reluctant stand, saying "it is troublesome to hold joint event to mark June 15 before south Korea-U.S. summit and the issue will be examined within the framework of international sanctions".
					
					 This is just a serious anti-reunification act of chilling the atmosphere for holding the joint national event for improving the north-south relations and opening a new chapter for reconciliation and unity like the June 15 era as early as possible.
					
					 What all the more matters is the ridiculous attitude of the south Korean authorities who talk about improved north-south ties even though they are reading the face of the U.S. and the conservative forces without principle.
					
					 The democratic and reformist "governments" in the past did not get approval of the U.S. or agreement from the conservative forces to adopt the north-south declarations. The south Korean authorities should clearly understand this.
					
					 Allowing NGO exchanges only while evading such fundamental issues as the implementation of the north-south declaration would not bring the improvement of the north-south ties.
					
					 The hesitant stand of the present south Korean authorities leaves us skeptical as to whether it has inherited the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and has the willingness to speak for the candlelight demonstrators.
					
					 The south Korean authorities will only be made to face the same miserable fate as the conservative regime which was denounced and cursed by the public without having any dialogue with the north during its rule, to say nothing of improving the north-south relations.
					
					 They should no longer mock the nation and the public desirous of the improvement of the north-south ties and peace and reunification of the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: SWUK Delegation Leaves for Italy
articles.content:
SWUK Delegation Leaves for Italy
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Socialist Women's Union of Korea (SWUK) led by Chae Chun Hui, vice-chairwoman of its Central Committee, left here Thursday to attend a meeting of the Secretariat of the Women's International Democratic Federation to be held in Rome of Italy.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Bangladeshi Prime Minister
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Bangladeshi Prime Minister
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent a message of sympathy to Sheikh Hasina, prime minister of Bangladesh, on Thursday over tropical heavy rains that caused landslides in the southern part of the country causing heavy casualties and material loss.
					 The message hoped that the Bangladeshi government would eradicate the aftermath of the disaster and bring to normal the life of the residents in the affected area as early as possible.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation of Ministry of Railways Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation of Ministry of Railways Back Home
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Ministry of Railways led by Minister Jang Hyok returned home Thursday after taking part in the 45th ministerial meeting of the Organization of Railways Cooperation held in Sochi of Russia.

articles.title: Officials and Members of Women's Union Meet
articles.content:
Officials and Members of Women's Union Meet
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- A meeting of officials and members of the women's union took place here on Thursday in celebration of the 53rd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Jang Chun Sil, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the women's union, made a report which was followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that since Kim Jong Il started his guidance over the Party at the supreme staff of the Korean revolution, steady continuity had been given to the sacred history and traditions of the WPK that started with the "Down-with-Imperialism Union" and the WPK had developed into a revolutionary party in which its leader's ideological and guidance system is firmly established, a motherly party serving the people and an invincible party with strong organizing ability and combat efficiency.
					
					 While leading the Party, he explored the new phase for revolutionary party building and laid an eternal foundation for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche, they stressed.
					
					 They noted that under the loving care of the leader who showed the road for the women's union to follow in every period and stage of the development of the revolution, the union could creditably discharge its mission and duty as a reliable helper and transmission belt of the Party.
					
					 They stressed the need for all officials and members of the women's union to fulfill their duty as women revolutionaries in faithfully upholding the cause of the great Party of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, united closer around respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: National Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held
articles.content:
National Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- A national seminar on leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday.
					 The work, published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997), clarifies the idea that the Juche character and national character in the revolution and construction means independence and gives exposition of the principled problems arising in preserving them.
					
					 The seminar heard papers proving the scientific accuracy, validity and vitality of the work and dealing with the tasks and ways for hastening the final victory of socialism by firmly preserving the Juche character and national character in the revolutionary struggle.
					
					 The speakers said that the publication of the work at the time when the imperialists were conducting the frantic anti-socialist offensive was a historic event as it indicated the way for saving socialism from crisis and paving a wide avenue for its victorious advance.
					
					 They explained that preserving the Juche character and national character is the basic principle to be maintained in accomplishing the socialist cause. 
					
					 The idea of preserving the Juche character and national character has fully demonstrated its vitality in building Korean-style socialism dignified with independence, they said, adding: Its validity has been proved in the struggle to build an independent world while smashing the imperialists' moves for domination, subjugation, aggression and interference.
					
					 They stressed the need to firmly preserve the Juche character and national character and achieve the final victory of the cause of Juche revolution as early as possible, under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present at the seminar were officials of central and city party and administrative organs, working people's organizations, scientific, educational, literature and arts and media institutions, party cadres training institutions and the field of preservation of revolutionary relics.

articles.title: Int'l Presentation of Science and Technology to Be Held Here
articles.content:
Int'l Presentation of Science and Technology to Be Held Here
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang International Presentation of Science and Technology of Health and Household Medical Utensils will take place at the Sci-Tech Complex from June 22 to 26.
					 Health food and products, medicines and household medical utensils will be shown at the presentation participated in by more than one hundred organizations of various countries including the DPRK and regions.
					
					 The presentation includes a symposium on technology, intellectual product trade and sale of exhibits.
					
					 The presentation, the first to be held in the DPRK, will provide an occasion of developing cooperation and exchange between countries and regions in the sphere of medical science and technology and contributing to promoting the people's health.

articles.title: Mangyongdae Children's Camp
articles.content:
Mangyongdae Children's Camp
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- Schoolchildren in the DPRK are enjoying a pleasant camp life since when the hot season set in.
					 Among those camps crowed with schoolchildren is the Mangyongdae Children's Camp located at the foot of picturesque Mt Ryongak in Pyongyang.
					
					 The camp was successfully renovated into a comprehensive extracurricular education base for schoolchildren in June last year thanks to the loving care of the Workers' Party of Korea for the younger generation.
					
					 Jong Hak Myong, a pupil from Puhung Primary School in Phyongchon District, told KCNA that he feels satisfaction at bedrooms, rooms for folk games and video games, library and so on.
					
					 In the compound of the camp, there is a hall with its facade bearing letters "We Are the Happiest in the World", in which campers can play music or sing songs.
					
					 During the camping, schoolchildren acquire versatile knowledge and cultivate their cognitive power through diverse sports and other activities like mountaineering. And they are given a chance of cooking meals.
					
					 According to Kim Chol San, director of the camp, the camp has been further spruced up over the last one year after its reconstruction. Walk-ways from lodgings to restaurant and outdoor basketball court were roofed, a water slide was installed at the open-air swimming pool and animal sheds were newly built, he said.
					
					 When visiting the reconstructed camp in June last year, respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un called for making children enjoy happiness to be envied by the world, so that the song "We Are the Happiest in the World" should be reverberated down through generations.

articles.title: Success Made in Artificial Production of Myongthae Fries
articles.content:
Success Made in Artificial Production of Myongthae Fries
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- A success was recently made in artificial breeding of myongthae (Alaska Pollack) fries in the DPRK.
					 Sci-tech problems arising in artificial taking of myongthae roes and breeding of fries were settled in a peculiar way.
					
					 In particular, the Ryonjin Fishery Station began home production of main food for myongthae fries by cultivating adhesive diatom, rotifers and shellfish larvae.
					
					 According to data available at the Ministry of Fisheries, hundreds of thousands myongthae fries have been stocked into the East Sea of Korea on several occasions from late April to early May.
					
					 In this regard, Hong Hyon Chol, deputy director of a department of the ministry, told KCNA that the biological indicators of recently stocked fries reached a high level and prospects of myongthae farming in the East Sea are splendid for its ideal oceanographic conditions.
					
					 Now, it has been dynamically pushed forward to lay a solid material and technical foundation in an area favorable for large-scale myongthae farming and adopt a system for cyclic production of myongthae fries.

articles.title: Japanese Government Urged to Make Sincere Apology for Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Japanese Government Urged to Make Sincere Apology for Sexual Slavery
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea reportedly issued a statement on June 12 to denounce Japan for its impudent action to cover up the crimes related to sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 It accused Prime Minister Abe's special envoy of his assertion that the issue of sexual slavery was solved and Japan paid money for it and so the story of renegotiations does not be allowed worldwide and those who resort to wiles in south Korea-Japan relations should be ousted.
					
					 The "agreement" on sexual slavery is a product of Park Geun Hye's treacherous policy and the victims and other people have never accepted it, the statement said.
					
					 What the victims are demanding is apology and reparation as well as assurance for prevention of recurrence of such crime, it stressed, urging the Japanese government to stop at once all scenarios for erasing the history as an offender of war crimes and make a sincere apology to the victims.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from General Association of Koreans in China
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from General Association of Koreans in China
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a letter from the General Association of Koreans in China on Thursday, the 17th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 The letter said the Association and all Koreans in China extend high tribute to the great leader Generalissimo Kim Jong Il who provided the historic north-south summit in Pyongyang and made public the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration to pave an avenue for the nation toward independent reunification.
					
					 The letter went on:
					
					 The declaration instilled bright hope and confidence in national reunification into all Koreans, and it is still shedding its rays as the great programme of the nation for reunification which ushered in a new era of reunification for the first time in the history of national division.
					
					 The more desperate moves of the traitors, seized with sycophancy toward big powers, confrontation with the compatriots and "unification by absorption", against the DPRK and reunification, and increasing danger of north-targeted nuclear war only have made all Koreans more deeply realize how valuable the June 15 era of reunification was and stage more dynamic struggle to preserve and give steady continuity to the era, and it has become an unquenchable desire of all Koreans.
					
					 Now all Koreans in the north and the south and abroad are filled with the pride and honor of holding you as the father of the nation and are full of enthusiasm to surely bring about a decisive turn in the drive for national reunification earlier by implementing the north-south joint declarations provided by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The officials of the association and all Koreans in China will devote themselves to the patriotic struggle for ushering in a new era of independent reunification, peace and prosperity with the faith that reunification is sure to come under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un, the letter stressed.

articles.title: June 15 Joint Declaration Is Declaration of Independence and Great National Unity: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
June 15 Joint Declaration Is Declaration of Independence and Great National Unity: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 17th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration, a monumental document and the supreme reunification programme of the nation that put the principle of national reunification and the ways for achieving it into an agreement of the Korean nation. 
					 The adoption of the June 15 joint declaration was a special event as it put a period to the history of distrust and confrontation, which had continued for more than half a century, and ushered in a new era of national reconciliation and unity, reunification and peace and prosperity, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an article.
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration is a declaration of national independence and great national unity based on the idea of By Our Nation Itself and consistent with patriotism, the article said, adding:
					
					 Since its publication, signal achievements had been made one after another in the north-south relations.
					
					 It is the fundamental feature of the June 15 era of reunification that the movement for national reunification rapidly developed into a nationwide movement with all Koreans involved, irrespective of authorities, NGOs and ideology, political view, faction and party affiliation. 
					
					 The June 15 banner is the signpost of peace, reunification and national prosperity and nothing is better than the road indicated by June 15. The historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration are the greatest documents for the north-south relations that all Koreans should respect and consider sacred, and nothing can be placed above them.
					
					 How to approach the said declarations will distinguish reunification from division, peace from war and patriotism from treachery. 
					
					 The June 15 era of reunification proved in practice that the differing ideology and social system existing in the north and the south could not be a cause of confrontation and that the Korean nation can get reconciled and united and build a peaceful and prosperous, reunified country.

articles.title: Removal of THAAD Hardware Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Removal of THAAD Hardware Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- The Songju Committee for Struggle against THAAD Deployment, the Action for Checking THAAD Deployment and other organizations in south Korea reportedly issued a statement on June 12 in demand of the immediate withdrawal of THAAD.
					 The statement contended that every move related to THAAD should be stopped at once and all introduced hardware be withdrawn.

articles.title: Verification of Results of Investigation into Warship Cheonan Sinking Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Verification of Results of Investigation into Warship Cheonan Sinking Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- The media and academic headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration and other organizations of south Korea held round-table talks on June 12.
					 At the talks, they called for verifying the results of investigation into the case of warship Cheonan sinking published by the Lee Myung Bak regime of traitors.
					
					 They said there are many questions as lot of things in the results are not understandable.
					
					 There are some witnesses to the incident but they don't say the truth in fear of being punished by the military law, they noted, urging the present regime of south Korea to take a responsible step to tackle it.

articles.title: Pochonbo Battle Introduced by German, British Organizations
articles.content:
Pochonbo Battle Introduced by German, British Organizations
Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- German and British organizations on June 4 and 5 posted on their internet homepages articles marking the 80th anniversary of the victorious Pochonbo battle.
					 In an article illustrated with the photo of President Kim Il Sung, the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany said:
					
					 Fierce flames that raged in Pochonbo 80 years ago are still now implanting the conviction of victory into the Korean people.
					
					 At the Xigang meeting in 1937 the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung set forth the policy of dealing blows at the Japanese imperialist aggressors and inspiring the people with hope of national liberation through the advancement of large guerrilla unit into the homeland.
					
					 The Korean People's Revolutionary Army started the Pochonbo battle according to the signal gun report made by him at 10 p.m. on June 4, engulfing the Japanese imperialists' plundering institutions in flames in a moment.
					
					 The speech made by Kim Il Sung before crowds of the people who came out to the street, shouting "Long Live General Kim Il Sung!" instilled into the people the confidence that Korea was not dead but alive and encouraged them to turn out in the sacred war for national liberation.
					
					 In an article, the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy referred in detail to the significance of the victorious Pochonbo battle.
					
					 The article stressed that just as the Korean people accomplished the historic cause of national liberation by rallying themselves around President Kim Il Sung, they are struggling to reunify the country without fail under the banner of great national unity, holding respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in high esteem.

articles.title: Liberado ciudadano norteamericano
articles.content:
Liberado ciudadano norteamericano
Pyongyang, 15 de junio (ACNC) -- Segun el veredicto fechado 13 del Tribunal Central de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, fue devuelto el dia 13 desde el punto de vista humanitaria el ciudadano norteamericano Otto Frederick Warmbier, que estaba en el trabajo reeducativo.

articles.title: Ri Hung Sik pronuncia discurso en reunion internacional
articles.content:
Ri Hung Sik pronuncia discurso en reunion internacional
Pyongyang, 15 de junio (ACNC) -- El embajador del MINREX Ri Hung Sik, quien preside la delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, hizo uso de la palabra el dia 13 en la 10a sesion de la Conferencia de los Estados Partidarios de la Convencion de los Derechos de las Personas con Discapacidades que tiene lugar en Nueva York de Estados Unidos. 
					El se refirio primero a la politica y los esfuerzos del gobierno de la RPDC por proteger y fomentar los derechos humanos y defender los derechos de los discapacitados.
					
					La RPDC es el Estado socialista humano-centrico que pone el ser humano en el centro y lo todo de la sociedad sirve para el hombre, comenzo el embajador y prosiguio:
					
					Dar prioridad a los intereses y comodidad del pueblo considerandolos absolutos es el maximo principio de actividades estatales y la lucha por ese fin es una obligacion constitucional del Estado. 
					
					Hoy dia, gracias a la politica de apreciar, respetar y amar al pueblo que practica el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, todos los miembros de la sociedad, inclusive los discapacitados, ejercen sustancialmente los verdaderos derechos humanos.
					
					Consideramos importantes la ejecucion de la convencion de derechos de las personas con discapacidades y la cooperacion internacional para proteger, fomentar y mejorar los derechos de la poblacion discapacitada.
					
					Por esta razon, la RPDC adopto en julio de 2013 la "Convencion de los Derechos de las Personas con Discapacidades", enmendo y suplemento segun sus demandas la ley nacional de proteccion de discapacitados y firmo la convencion en noviembre de 2016. 
					
					A pesar de la persistente amenaza politico-militar proveniente del exterior, la RPDC desarrolla una ofensiva general de todo el pueblo para cumplir la Estrategia Quinquenal para el Desarrollo de la Economia Nacional 2016 - 2020. 
					
					Concedemos importancia a la cooperacion internacional, inclusive la colaboracion tecnica y humanitaria de los aparatos de la ONU, en ejecutar cabalmente la convencion. 
					
					Al respecto, nuestra delegacion hace referencia especial a la visita a nuestro pais de la reportera especial para los derechos de los discapacitados del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU que se llevo a cabo con exito como parte de implementacion de la convencion.  
					
					Estamos seguros de que la visita de la reportera sirvio de una oportunidad importante para profundizar la comprension mutua entre la RPDC y el comite de derechos de discapacitados, estructurar y desarrollar las constructivas relaciones de cooperacion. 
					
					Rechazamos totalmente la politizacion de DDHH, la selectividad y la pauta de doble rasero en los escenarios internacionales de DDHH y nos oponemos resueltamente a cualquier intento de abusar de este tema para el siniestro objetivo politico.
					
					Es invariable nuestra posicion de apreciar el dialogo y cooperacion en el sector internacional de DDHH orientados a proteger y fomentar los verdaderos derechos humanos incluyendo la proteccion de derechos de los discapacitados. 
					
					En otra palabra, rechazamos la discusion de DDHH extremadamente politizada que sostienen las fuerzas hostiles a base de las declaraciones falsas y datos inventados de los criminales, que huyeron traicionando al pais y la nacion y abandonando hasta a sus familiares, para alcanzar su siniestra meta de derrocar un Estado soberano, algo enajenado de los derechos humanos. Pero, mantenemos invariablemente la posicion de dinamizar el dialogo y la cooperacion por la defensa y el fomento de verdaderos derechos humanos.   
					
					Siendo pais partidario de la convencion de derechos de las personas con discapacidades, la RPDC cumplira con su deber en el cumplimiento de la meta de 10 anos presentada por la presente conferencia y hara mucho aporte a los esfuerzos internacionales por ejecutar la convencion al intensificar el intercambio y la cooperacion con el comite de derechos de los discapacitados, las organizaciones internacionales y otros paises.

articles.title: Portavoz del CRN censura a autoridades surcoreanas que se burlan de la nacion
articles.content:
Portavoz del CRN censura a autoridades surcoreanas que se burlan de la nacion
Pyongyang, 15 de junio (ACNC) -- Debido a la postura irresoluta y ambigua de las autoridades surcoreanas no se ha realizado el acto conjunto nacional del Norte, el Sur y el ultramar, planeado con motivo del 17o aniversario de la publicacion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio.
					Al respecto, el portavoz del Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional hizo publica el dia 15 una declaracion siguiente:
					
					La actitud sobre este acto conjunto nacional deviene una piedra de toque que hace analizar la posicion de las actuales autoridades surcoreanas con respecto a la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas y la reunificacion.
					
					Pero, desde el comienzo ellas no mostraban la actitud positiva diciendo que "les molesta el problema de realizar el acto conjunto por el 15 de Junio antes de sostener la Cumbre Surcorea-EE.UU." y que "lo examinaran en el marco de sancion internacional".
					
					Esto deviene un grave acto criminal anti-reunificacion que echa agua fria al ambiente por el acto conjunto nacional, que sera nueva oportunidad para mejorar lo mas pronto posible las relaciones N-S y lograr la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales como la epoca del 15 de Junio.
					
					Resulta absurdo que las autoridades surcoreanas hablan de la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas en una situacion miserable de observar la actitud de EE.UU. y las fuerzas conservadoras.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben saber correctamente que al aprobar las declaraciones N-S los anteriores "poderes" de reforma democratica no querian el permiso de EE.UU. o el acuerdo con las fuerzas conservadoras.
					
					Las relaciones N-S no se mejoran con el permiso de algunos intercambios civiles evitando los problemas fundamentales como la ejecucion de las declaraciones N-S.
					
					La actitud indecisa de las actuales autoridades surcoreanas nos hace dudar de que el actual "poder" herede el espiritu de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y de la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre y quiere representar la opinion publica manifestada en la lucha con velas.
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas siguen actuando como ahora, podran repetir solo el fracaso del "poder" conservador que fue objeto de la censura y odio del interior y exterior de la nacion sin hacer nada por la mejora de las relaciones Norte-Sur ni realizar ningun dialogo verdadero durante todo el periodo de su mandato.
					
					Ellas no deben burlarse mas de toda la nacion y la opinion publica de diversos estratos que desean la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas y la paz y reunificacion de la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Vocero de UPC advierte a los medios de prensa conservadores del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Vocero de UPC advierte a los medios de prensa conservadores del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 15 de junio (ACNC) -- En estos dias, los medios de prensa conservadores del Sur de Corea se atreven a calumniar la politica de amor a las generaciones venideras del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					Al respecto, el portavoz del Comite Central de la Union de Periodistas de Corea publico el dia 15 una declaracion que sigue:
					
					KBS, MBN, Yonhap News y otros medios de prensa conservadores reportan la chismografia sobre el VIII Congreso de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea calificandolo de "acto de caracter demostrativo para el mantenimiento del regimen".
					
					Para colmo, se atrevieron a insultar hasta la dignidad de nuestra Direccion Suprema.
					
					Por conducto de los especialistas falsos y "fugitivos norcoreanos", la cadena de radiodifusion publica KBS induce en error la opinion publica como si se produjera algun cambio en la mentalidad de nuestros jovenes y ninos haciendo referencia a la "generacion del mercado" y "limite de inyeccion de ideologia".
					
					Esto demuestra claramente a que grado ha llegado la fiebre conflictiva de los medios y los plumiferos conservadores que estan desesperados para tomar hasta a los ninos como victimas de la campana intrigante anti-RPDC.
					
					Ya hemos advertido a los medios de prensa conservadores y la chusma de periodistas como deben pagar su crimen de lanzar la demagogia anti-RPDC tergiversando la realidad. 
					
					En particular, es resuelta y consecuente nuestra posicion de castigar de manera mas implacable a los que calumnian la dignidad de nuestra Direccion Suprema persiguiendolos hasta el ultimo rincon del planeta.
					
					Los medios de prensa conservadores y los plumiferos, que se atrevieron a criticar la noble politica de amor a las generaciones venideras del PTC, y los que estan detras de ellos deben conocer que viviran desde ahora con el miedo e inquietud.
					
					Si estan interesadas de veras en la mejora de relaciones Norte-Sur, las autoridades surcoreanas han de averiguar sin demora el tremendo acto provocativo anti-RPDC de los medios de prensa y castigar duro a los responsables.
					
					Si no escuchan esta demanda, ajustaremos las cuentas considerando que ellas organizaron el presente crimen horrible.
					
					Los criminales que desafiaron a la dignidad de nuestra Direccion Suprema no deben esperar que puedan estar sanos y salvos.
